name: StairUseADLOrIADL
title: Stair Use (ADL or IADL)
description: This value set may undergo changes until the HL7 Multiple Chronic Care FHIR IG is formally published in 2024.
purpose: (Clinical Focus: This set of values addresses terms representing an observation of stair use (ADL/IADL) ability.),(Data Element Scope: The intent of this set of values is to identify patients who have a/an assessment of the person's ability to use the stairs as an adl/iadl.),(Inclusion Criteria: Includes LOINC codes for Stair Use (ADL or IADL).),(Exclusion Criteria: Terms not representative of observable encoded terms that may have values indicating Stair Use (ADL or IADL).)

contains.display: Prior functioning.stairs - ambulation [CARE]
Are you able to go up and down stairs at a normal pace [PROMIS]
Does your health now limit you in climbing several flights of stairs [PROMIS]
Does your health now limit you in climbing one flight of stairs [PROMIS]
I was too tired to go up and down a lot of stairs in past 7 days [PROMIS]
If I walk up one flight of stairs, I have to go slowly or stop [PhenX]
How much difficulty do you currently have going up and down a flight of stairs inside, using a handrail [NeuroQol]
How much difficulty do you currently have climbing stairs step over step without a handrail - alternating feet [NeuroQol]
Climbing stairs - difficulty [OPTIMAL]
Climbing stairs - confidence [OPTIMAL]
Do you have serious difficulty walking or climbing stairs
Does your health now limit you in climbing one flight of stairs [Veterans RAND]
Does your health now limit you in climbing several flights of stairs [Veterans RAND]
Do you have difficulty walking or climbing stairs [HHS.ACA Section 4302.ONC]
Over the past week, are you able to go up two or more flights of stairs [HAQII]
Are you able to go up and down stairs [PROMIS]
Climbing stairs [ALSFRS-R]
Stairs [CMS Assessment]
Climbing a flight of stairs without stopping was limited by heart failure over the past 2 weeks [KCCQ]
Degree of difficulty experienced due to your hip while ascending stairs in the last week [HOOS]
Degree of difficulty experienced due to your hip while descending stairs in the last week [HOOS]
Degree of difficulty experienced due to your knee while ascending stairs in the last week [KOOS]
Degree of difficulty experienced due to your knee while descending stairs in the last week [KOOS]
Considering your shortness of breath over the past 7 days, rate the amount of difficulty you had when walking up 20 stairs (2 flights) without stopping [PROMIS]
Considering your shortness of breath over the past 7 days, rate the amount of difficulty you had when walking up 5 stairs without stopping [PROMIS]
Considering your shortness of breath over the past 7 days, rate the amount of difficulty you had when walking up 10 stairs (1 flight) without stopping [PROMIS]
Considering your shortness of breath over the past 7 days, rate the amount of difficulty you had when walking up 30 stairs (3 flights) without stopping [PROMIS]
How many days were you strong enough to go up and down stairs in past 7 days [PROMIS.PEDS]
Current level of confidence I can climb one flight of stairs (with or without rails) [PROMIS]
Stairs - functional ability
